title: By selling 15 mangoes, a fruit seller gains the selling price of 3 mangoes. What is his gain percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: I cannot see a gain here. He had to sell 15 Fifteen mangoes in order to equate the selling price of Only 3 mangoes? so assuming one mango sold for $10 3 mangoes would have sold for 3*10 =$30 then 15 mangoes would have sold for 15*10 = $150 However, in order to equate the selling price of 3 mangoes which is $30 he would have had to sell the 15 mangoes for $2 each and NOT $10 each because 15*2 =$30 Thus I simply cannot see a gain percentage here
Selling price of each mango = s rupees Selling price of 15 mangoes = 15s rupees Gain = 3s rupees Cost price of 15 mangoes = (15s - 3s) rupees = 12s rupees. Gain percentage = (3s / 12s) * 100% = 25%.
